description: Clean the sink, faucet, and counter in the kitchen
Sweep around the kitchen island and under the dining room table
Vacuum the stairs from the living room up to the music room/entryway and the stairs from the entryway to the upstairs hallway
Vacuum the red room
Vacuum the music room (the room between the living room and the dining room)
Clean the inside and face of the microwave, the rotating plate, and the food cover

Clean the left fridge (personal fridge) - does not include the freezer, just the fridge. Also doesn't include going through the food inside. Remove all food, clean the interior, then place the food back inside.

Clean the right fridge (public fridge) - does not include the freezer, just the fridge. Also doesn't include going through the food inside. Remove all food, clean the interior, then place the food back inside.

Clean the left freezer (personal freezer) - does not include the fridge, just the freezer. Also doesn't include going through the food inside. Remove all food, clean the interior, then place the food back inside.

Clean the middle freezer (public freezer) - does not include the fridge, just the freezer. Also doesn't include going through the food inside. Remove all food, clean the interior, then place the food back inside.

Clean the right freezer (full-size freezer) - does not include the fridge, just the freezer. Also doesn't include going through the food inside. Remove all food, clean the interior, then place the food back inside.

This chore does not include actually cleaning the fridge. Take out all food in the left (personal) fridge and go through it. Throw away any moldy food or anything that is suspicious (if marked with a date I would say that's generally about 2 weeks). If the food has a name on it, ask the person directly. If it's unlabelled, it's up to your discretion. Put back all the food that remains.

This chore does not include actually cleaning the fridge. Take out all food in the right (public) fridge and go through it. Throw away any moldy food or anything that is suspicious (if marked with a date I would say that's generally about 2 weeks). If the food has a name on it, ask the person directly. If it's unlabelled, it's up to your discretion. Put back all the food that remains.

This chore does not include actually cleaning the freezer. Take out all food in the left (personal) freezer and go through it. Throw away any moldy food or anything that is suspicious (if marked with a date I would say that's generally about 2 weeks). If the food has a name on it, ask the person directly. If it's unlabelled, it's up to your discretion. Put back all the food that remains.

This chore does not include actually cleaning the freezer. Take out all food in the middle (public) freezer and go through it. Throw away any moldy food or anything that is suspicious (if marked with a date I would say that's generally about 2 weeks). If the food has a name on it, ask the person directly. If it's unlabelled, it's up to your discretion. Put back all the food that remains.

This chore does not include actually cleaning the freezer. Take out all food in the right (full-size) freezer and go through it. Throw away any moldy food or anything that is suspicious (if marked with a date I would say that's generally about 2 weeks). If the food has a name on it, ask the person directly. If it's unlabelled, it's up to your discretion. Put back all the food that remains.

Take any burnables near the fireplace in the kitchen and near the door in the music room, place them in the firepit outside, and burn them. Even if there's nothing inside, check the firepit and burn anything that's piled up there.

displayName: Clean out ashes from kitchen fireplace
description: Remove grill and main tray, clean out ashes and dispose of in the garden or compost. Vacuum around the fireplace to clean up any remaining ashes. Replace the grill and tray.
Clean the sink and faucet in the laundry room
Dust the ceiling and walls in the laundry room
Dust the ceiling and walls in the kitchen, including the dining area
Dust the ceiling and walls in the living room
Dust the ceiling and walls in the music room (the room between the living room and the dining room)
Dust the ceiling and walls in the red room
Dust the ceiling and walls in the upstairs hallway
Dust the ceiling and walls in the entryway (near the front door)
Sweep and then mop the floor in the laundry room, moving items as needed
Sweep and then mop the floor in the kitchen and dining area, moving items as needed
Sweep and then mop the floor in the entryway, moving items as needed
Sweep and then mop the floor in the downstairs bathroom, moving items as needed
Clean the downstairs toilet. This includes all ceramic surfaces and the tops and bottoms of all lids.
Clean the upstairs toilet. This includes all ceramic surfaces and the tops and bottoms of all lids.
Clean the downstairs bathroom mirror. This includes the frame of the mirror - make sure to get the top where dust may accumulate.
Clean the sink, faucet, and counter in the downstairs bathroom
Clean the upstairs bathroom mirrors. This includes the frame of the mirror - make sure to get the top where dust may accumulate.
Clean the sink, faucet, and counter upstairs, outside the bathroom
Sweep and then mop the floor in the upstairs bathroom, moving items as needed
Clean the tub part of the upstairs bathroom shower. This doesn't include the walls or upper parts of the shower
Clean the inside and outside of ALL panes of the window in front of the kitchen sink
Clean the inside and outside of ALL panes of the window in front of the dining room table
Clean the inside and outside of ALL panes of the window in the music room (the room between the living room and the dining room) - includes the door window
Clean the inside and outside of ALL panes of the window in the living room (excludes skylight unless you're feeling brave)
Clean the inside and outside of ALL panes of the window in the red room - includes the door window

Take all hand towels from the kitchen and the bathrooms, replace with clean ones, and wash and dry the dirty ones. Make sure to use vinegar and baking soda (don't pour them both in together though! use the bleach tray for the vinegar)

Take the rug from the upstairs bathroom (in front of the shower) and replace with a clean one. Wash and dry the dirty one. Make sure to use vinegar and baking soda (don't pour them both in together though! use the bleach tray for the vinegar)
Take all blankets from the couches, under the window couch, and in the grey hamper in the living room and wash and dry them. Then, return them to the living room.
Take all blankets from the red room and wash and dry them. Then, return them to the red room.
Vacuum the floor in the upstairs hallway, moving items as needed
Clean the shower in the upstairs bathroom. This includes everything above the bathtub, and does not include the bathtub.
Clean inside and outside of ALL panes of the window in the laundry room

displayName: Clean out ashes from living room fireplace
description: Remove grill from the fireplace, take out ashes, and place them in the garden or compost. Vacuum around the fireplace to clean up any remaining ashes. Replace the grill.
Vacuum the floor in the living room, moving items as needed
